content: Berries are rich in antioxidants, which help reduce inflammation and oxidative stress in the body. This can lead to a reduced risk of cardiovascular disease. Berries contain flavonoids, including anthocyanins, which have been shown to have a positive effect on blood pressure and the function of blood vessels. Berries also contain fiber, which can help lower cholesterol levels and improve overall heart health. Additionally, some studies suggest that regular consumption of berries may help improve insulin resistance, which can also contribute to better cardiovascular health.
